intro.description: The TIPI personality assessment helps identify your 5 main personality traits:

traits.extraversion: Extraversion: Your level of outgoingness and energy
traits.agreeableness: Agreeableness: Your level of cooperation and trust
traits.conscientiousness: Conscientiousness: Your level of responsibility and discipline
traits.neuroticism: Neuroticism: Your level of anxiety and stress
traits.openness: Openness: Your level of openness to new experiences

instructions.title: Instructions:
items: ‚Ä¢ Each question is rated from 1 (strongly disagree) to 7 (strongly agree)
‚Ä¢ Please answer as honestly as possible

interpretation.title: Detailed Personality Analysis
interpretation.subtitle: Explore what your Big Five scores reveal about your behavioral tendencies, preferences, and how you typically interact with the world around you.

aboutModel.title: About the Big Five Model
aboutModel.description: The Big Five personality model is one of the most scientifically validated frameworks for understanding personality. It measures five broad dimensions that capture the most important ways people differ from each other psychologically.
aboutModel.note: Remember that personality traits exist on a continuum, and there are no "good" or "bad" scores. Each trait has its strengths and challenges, and the best outcomes often come from understanding and leveraging your natural tendencies.

levels.veryHigh: Very High - This trait is very prominent in your personality
levels.high: High - This trait is quite noticeable in your behavior
levels.moderate: Moderate - You show average levels of this trait
levels.low: Low - This trait is less prominent in your personality
levels.veryLow: Very Low - This trait is rarely expressed in your behavior
levels.neuroticismVeryHigh: Very High - You may experience frequent emotional ups and downs
levels.neuroticismHigh: High - You tend to react more emotionally to situations
levels.neuroticismModerate: Moderate - You have average emotional stability
levels.neuroticismLow: Low - You tend to be emotionally stable
levels.neuroticismVeryLow: Very Low - You are exceptionally calm and emotionally resilient

extraversion.name: Extraversion
extraversion.description: Measures your tendency to seek stimulation from the outside world, including social interaction and external activity.
extraversion.high: You tend to be outgoing, energetic, and assertive. You enjoy social situations, seek excitement, and are comfortable being the center of attention.
extraversion.low: You tend to be more reserved, quiet, and introspective. You prefer smaller groups or solo activities and may need alone time to recharge.
extraversion.moderate: You show moderate levels of extraversion. You may display both extraverted and introverted behaviors depending on the situation.

agreeableness.name: Agreeableness
agreeableness.description: Reflects your tendency to be cooperative, trusting, and considerate in your interactions with others.
agreeableness.high: You tend to be compassionate, trusting, and helpful. You value harmony in relationships and are generally optimistic about human nature.
agreeableness.low: You tend to be more skeptical, competitive, and straightforward. You may be willing to challenge others and prioritize your own interests.
agreeableness.moderate: You show moderate levels of agreeableness. You may display both high and low agreeable behaviors depending on the situation.

conscientiousness.name: Conscientiousness
conscientiousness.description: Measures your tendency to be organized, responsible, and goal-directed in your approach to tasks and commitments.
conscientiousness.high: You tend to be well-organized, disciplined, and reliable. You plan ahead, pay attention to details, and follow through on commitments.
conscientiousness.low: You tend to be more spontaneous, flexible, and relaxed. You may prefer to adapt as situations arise rather than follow strict plans.
conscientiousness.moderate: You show moderate levels of conscientiousness. You may display both high and low conscientious behaviors depending on the situation.

neuroticism.name: Neuroticism
neuroticism.description: Reflects your tendency to experience negative emotions and emotional stability under pressure.
neuroticism.high: You may be more sensitive to stress and prone to experiencing anxiety, worry, or mood swings. You might react more strongly to challenging situations.
neuroticism.low: You tend to be emotionally stable, calm, and resilient. You're able to stay composed under pressure and bounce back quickly from setbacks.
neuroticism.moderate: You show moderate levels of neuroticism. You may display both high and low neurotic behaviors depending on the situation.

openness.name: Openness to Experience
openness.description: Measures your curiosity, creativity, and willingness to explore new ideas, experiences, and ways of thinking.
openness.high: You tend to be imaginative, curious, and open to new experiences. You enjoy exploring ideas, appreciate art and beauty, and value intellectual pursuits.
openness.low: You tend to prefer familiar experiences and conventional approaches. You may be more practical and focused on concrete rather than abstract concepts.
openness.moderate: You show moderate levels of openness. You may display both high and low open behaviors depending on the situation.

summary.title: Understanding Your Unique Profile
summary.description: Your personality profile is unique to you. While these scores provide insights into your typical patterns of thinking, feeling, and behaving, remember that:

points.0: Personality can be expressed differently in different contexts
points.1: You have the ability to adapt your behavior when needed
points.2: All personality types have strengths and areas for growth
points.3: Understanding your tendencies can help you make better decisions about relationships, career, and personal development

summary.conclusion: Consider how these insights might apply to your daily life, relationships, and goals. Personality awareness is a powerful tool for personal growth and better self-understanding.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.description: Follow these steps to unlock all features and start your AI coaching journey

step1.title: Complete your personality assessment to unlock personalized features
